DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to regain range of motion of the great toe with dynamic splinting which will help reduce great toe's pain and swelling.
DOC.brief_title: Hallux Limitus Treated With Dynamic Splinting: A Randomized, Controlled Trial
DOC.detailed_description: Determine the efficacy of dynamic splinting in treating patients with hallux limitus, in a randomized, controlled trial.
DOC.criteria: Reduced flexibility in AROM of extension in the great toe Pain that is worsened by walking and/or squatting Impaired gait pattern Metatarsal stress fracture Interdigital neuroma Sesamoid pathology Gout Metatarsalgia
